text: Lambertus Emaline "Bert" Fenenga (March 6, 1890 – September 20, 1981) was an American football player and coach. He served as the head football coach at Northern State University (then known as Norther State Teachers College) in Aberdeen, South Dakota in 1917. As an undergraduate, he was credited with giving Yankton College its nickname, the "Greyhounds." ==References== ==External links== * Category:1890 births Category:1981 deaths Category:Northern State Wolves football coaches Category:Yankton Greyhounds football players Category:People from Douglas County, South Dakota Category:Players of American football from South Dakota
title: Bert Fenenga
